tasks.task: Check the oil and fluid levels in a tractor.
subtasks: Approach the tractor to inspect the oil level.
Lift the hood or bonnet of the tractor to access the engine compartment.
Locate the oil reservoir or sump and determine the oil level.
Compare the oil level to the maximum and minimum markings on the reservoir.
If the oil is below the minimum, add the correct type of oil as per the tractor's manual.

tasks.task: Service the air filters of a tractor.
subtasks: Identify the air filter housing or intake system on the tractor.
Remove the air filter cover or housing from the tractor's air intake.
Check the condition of the current air filter element(s).
If the filter is dirty or clogged, replace it with a new one.
Reinstall the air filter cover and check for proper seating.

tasks.task: Inspect and replace spark plugs in a tractor's engine.
subtasks: Find the access points or spark plug holes in the engine block.
Use a socket wrench to remove the spark plugs.
Examine each spark plug for wear, carbon build-up, or damage.
Replace any spark plugs that are worn or in poor condition with new ones.
Torque the spark plugs to the manufacturer's specified setting using a torque wrench.

tasks.task: Perform a visual inspection of the tractor's frame for any damages.
subtasks: Walk around the tractor to visually check the frame structure.
Look for cracks, bends, or signs of rust or corrosion.
Inspect the attachment points for implements or accessories.
Note any areas requiring repair or replacement before proceeding.

tasks.task: Check the condition and replace brake pads in the tractor’s hydraulic braking system.
subtasks: Locate the master cylinder reservoir in the tractor's brake system.
Drain the old brake fluid if necessary and clean the reservoir.
Check the brake fluid level and replace it if it is low.
Inspect the brake lines and hoses for any leaks or damage.
If necessary, replace brake pads and check the condition of the calipers.

tasks.task: Adjust the tractor’s steering mechanisms.
subtasks: Check the front and rear steering components for play or looseness.
Tighten any loose steering linkages or adjust steering tie rods if needed.
Test the steering responsiveness by turning the steering wheel and assessing precision.

tasks.task: Check the battery connections and terminal posts.
subtasks: Open the bonnet to access the battery located under the hood.
Clean the battery terminals and cable connections using a wire brush or cloth.
Check for corrosion around the terminals and replace the battery if it is failing.
Tighten the battery clamps to ensure a secure connection.

tasks.task: Check and adjust the tire pressure on the tractor’s wheels.
subtasks: Locate the tire pressure gauges and standard pressure values from the tractor’s manual.
Remove the valve caps and inflate the tires to the correct pressure using an air compressor.
Check the tread depth and replace tires if the minimum is reached.

tasks.task: Check the connections of the driveshaft and test the transmission to ensure smooth operation.
subtasks: Inspect the driveshaft for any signs of damage, leaks, or worn parts.
Test drive the tractor in different gears to check for unusual noises or vibrations.
Assess the shifting mechanism for smoothness and correct engagement.

tasks.task: Check the oil and fluid levels in a tractor.
subtasks: Approach the tractor to inspect the oil level.
Lift the hood of the tractor to access the engine compartment.
Locate the oil reservoir or sump and determine the oil level.
Compare the oil level to minimum and maximum markings.
Add oil if the level is below minimum.

tasks.task: Service the air filters of a tractor.
subtasks: Identify the air filter housing on the tractor.
Remove the air filter cover.
Check the condition of the current air filter element.
Replace the filter if dirty or clogged.
Reinstall the air filter cover.

tasks.task: Inspect and replace spark plugs in the tractor's engine.
subtasks: Locate spark plug access points.
Remove the spark plugs using a socket wrench.
Examine each spark plug for wear.
Replace damaged or worn spark plugs.
Torque the new spark plugs to the specified torque value.

tasks.task: Check the tractor’s frame for damage.
subtasks: Visually inspect the frame, hinge points, and structural elements.
Look for cracks, bends, rust, or corrosion.
Note areas needing repair or replacement.

tasks.task: Replace brake pads in the hydraulic braking system.
subtasks: Drain and clean the master cylinder reservoir.
Inspect brake fluid level and replace if necessary.
Check brake lines and hoses for damage.
Replace brake pads and caliper if required.

tasks.task: Adjust the steering mechanisms.
subtasks: Check front and rear steering components for play.
Tighten steering linkages or adjust tie rods.
Test steering responsiveness and adjust as needed.

tasks.task: Check the battery connections.
subtasks: Clean battery terminals and cable connections.
Inspect battery condition and replace if necessary.
Tighten battery clamps for secure connection.

tasks.task: Check the tire pressure.
subtasks: Inflate tires to the correct pressure.
Inspect tire tread depth and replace tires if necessary.

tasks.task: Test the driveshaft and transmission.
subtasks: Inspect the driveshaft for damage or leaks.
Conduct a test drive in different gears.
Assess shifting smoothness and adjust if needed.
